Phantom, The misnomer about "radicalization" of some Muslims is that the violence they perform is proscribed and demanded by the Koran. In other words, the so-called “radicals” are actually being "faithful" to their scriptures. Thus, anyone who does not impose violence and/or death to Christians and Jews (non-believers in Islam) is not being faithful. People wonder how a young person can be “radicalized” in Islam; well, it is because he or she actually reads what the Koran has to say and seeks to implement its teachings. Some will suggest that the Bible is also violent and indeed there are passages that speak of death and destruction. The difference is this: "open-ended violence performed at the personal level” (Koran) vs. "God dictated judgments" against specific groups in historical, non-repeating context (Bible). While some might dismiss this difference, it is significant and key. When Jesus came along, He revoked the death and destruction judgment (for sin) to "love your neighbor as yourselves", "pray for them that despitefully use you", and "turn the other cheek". The Koran comes along 600 years after Jesus' crucifixion and a person might be, but should not be, very confused trying to correlate what the Old Testament is saying (specific national judgment for sin in specific historical context during a dispensation of law), the New Testament is saying (Jesus universal message of salvation and love in a dispensation of grace), and then the words and instructions of the Koran (open-ended violence at the personal level). The Koran has nothing to do with God but everything to do with Satan. BB

It urges the Muslims to treat such people kindly and equitably. (Quran 2256) “There shall be no compulsion in religion….” (Quran 60 8) “God does not enjoin you from befriending those who do not evict you from your homes. You may befriend them and be equitable towards them. God loves the equitable.” (Quran 861) “If they resort to peace, so shall you and put your trust in God. I think you will find a NOT a lot of planes in the desert b - a few planes for which buyer deliberately delayed delivery due to financial problems- since payment is due on delivery c- many planes which have been traded in or ready to be scrapped out or resold. Location is mojave desert in calif a long time - well known scrap yard Aircraft heavy maintenance and storage [edit] The Mojave airport is also known as a storage location for commercial airliners, due to the vast area and dry desert conditions.[5] Numerous large Boeing, McDonnell Douglas, Lockheed, and Airbus aircraft owned by major airlines are stored at Mojave. Some aircraft reach the end of their useful lifetime and are scrapped at the Mojave aircraft boneyard, while others are refurbished and returned to active service.
